Alberta is one of Canada’s most resource-rich provinces. Its growing economy attracts immigrants from many countries and offers numerous business opportunities for foreign entrepreneurs. Foreign entrepreneurs who wish to settle in Alberta can immigrate using one of the province’s many Alberta Entrepreneur Immigration Program streams and obtain Canada PR by investment. This guide will discuss the eligibility requirements and the application process for the AAIP Entrepreneur Streams.

AAIP Streams for Entrepreneurs

Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP), formerly the Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program, consists of four distinct streams under the Alberta Entrepreneur Immigration Program for foreign entrepreneurs and business people who wish to set up or purchase businesses in the province. These are:

[/vc_column_text]
  • Alberta Rural Entrepreneur Stream
  • Alberta Graduate Entrepreneur Stream
  • Alberta Foreign Graduate Entrepreneur Stream
  • Alberta Self-Employed Farmer Stream

AAIP Rural Entrepreneur Stream

The Rural Entrepreneur Stream caters to foreign entrepreneurs and business people who wish to start or purchase a business in specific rural Alberta communities. This definition of “rural” refers to communities under 100,000. This entrepreneur program aims to stimulate the economy and create jobs in Alberta’s smaller communities.[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Program Basic Requirements”]

  • Minimum Net Worth: $300,000 CAD
  • Minimum Investment: $200,000 CAD
  • Ownership: 51% or greater
  • Experience: Min. 3 years as a business owner, or 4 years in a senior management role.
  • Education: Completed high school (ECA required)
  • Language Proficiency: CLB4 or Above in English or French.
  • Job Creation: Mandatory
  • Community Support Letter: Mandatory

use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1650504863905{margin-top: 40px !important;}”]The eligibility requirements for the Graduate Entrepreneur Stream and the Foreign Graduate Entrepreneur Stream are compared side-by-side in the table below.

RequirementsGraduate StreamForeign Graduate Stream
Work ExperienceThere is no minimum requirement, but applicants can receive additional points for business ownership or management experience.Applicants must possess a minimum of 6 months of experience as a business owner or manager.
Minimum EducationApplicants must have completed a program lasting two or more years at an Alberta College or University. They must have received their degree or diploma after completing this program.Applicants must possess a College or University degree obtained from an education institution outside Canada. This degree must be equivalent to a Canadian one and should have been acquired within the last ten years.
Business ProposalNot requiredRequired
Minimum Business Ownership Percentage34% or higher34% or higher if the business is in an urban center. 51% or higher if the business is not in an urban center.
Minimum Investment AmountNone$100,000 CAD if the business is located in an urban center. $50,000 CAD if the business is not in an urban center.
Pitch DeckNot requiredRequired
Letter of Recommendation from Designated AgencyNot requiredRequired
Settlement FundsNot requiredApplicants must demonstrate they possess enough funds to settle in the province with their families.
